page.title: 19 Water Supply Services
page.content: The storage towers at Doddington and Earls Barton are made of concrete and are circular with domed roofs. The Earls Barton tower holds 400,000 gallons of water and the Doddington one 30,000 gallons.They are filled to capacity during the night and the water is drawn off at peak times during the day,such as mornings or evenings, or if there is a sudden emergency, such as a burst water main. The two towers serve the surrounding villages and part of Wellingborough. At present all service pipes under- ground are black iron pipes; but they are in the process of being replaced with more pliable blue plastic pipes. These will be long lasting and more easily distinguished from the new red electricity pipes and new yellow gas pipes which will all be lying together under the ground.
